item.title: 投资者押注美联储在暂停加息后将进一步降息以支撑市场
item.description: 华尔街预计美联储的货币宽松周期将在杰罗姆·鲍威尔主席任期结束前维持暂停状态，迫使投资者押注年内进一步降息以支撑看涨头寸。【原文：Wall Street is anticipating a pause in the Federal Reserve's monetary easing cycle to last through the remainder of Chair Jerome Powell's term that ends in May, forcing investors to bank on further ​rate cuts later in the year to support bullish positioning.】

item.title: 霍尼韦尔第四季度营收增长，得益于航空航天服务需求的持续强劲
item.description: 霍尼韦尔周四报告称，受航空航天部门和售后市场服务持续强劲表现的推动，公司第四季度营收和利润均实现增长。【原文：Honeywell reported a rise in fourth-quarter revenue and profit on Thursday, buoyed by continued strength in its aerospace unit and aftermarket services.】

item.title: 研究人员警告：开源人工智能模型易遭犯罪滥用
item.description: 研究人员周四表示，黑客和其他犯罪分子能够轻易劫持运行开源大型语言模型的计算机，这些计算机不受主要人工智能平台的防护措施和限制约束，从而造成安全风险和漏洞。【原文：Hackers and other criminals can easily commandeer computers operating open-source large language models outside the guardrails and constraints of the major artificial-intelligence platforms, creating security risks and vulnerabilities, researchers said on Thursday.】

item.title: 加拿大央行行长警告称，特朗普政策可能引发前所未有的新经济冲击
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫·麦克勒姆向路透社表示，鉴于地缘政治风险升温及美国贸易政策，他认为经济可能面临新一轮冲击的风险显著增加。【原文：Bank ​of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem told Reuters he saw unusual potential for a new shock to the economy, given ‌elevated geopolitical risks and U.S. trade policy.】

item.title: 地缘政治因素对大型石油公司盈利构成重大影响，投资者正密切关注委内瑞拉相关细节
item.description: 埃克森美孚和雪佛龙的高管们周五与分析师举行电话会议时，可能面临更多关于他们在委内瑞拉投资机会的问题，而非实际季度收益。【原文：Exxon Mobil and Chevron executives may face more questions about their investment opportunities in Venezuela than their actual quarterly earnings when they hold calls with analysts on Friday.】

item.title: 美国股指期货小幅上扬，市场消化科技巨头财报
item.description: 周四美国股指期货小幅走高，投资者正权衡科技巨头新一轮人工智能相关支出激增的影响，同时美联储如预期般维持利率不变。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on ​Thursday, as investors weighed another surge in AI-related spending from the tech mega-caps and the ‌Federal Reserve held rates steady as expected.】

item.title: 三星、SK海力士警告称，由于人工智能热潮，个人电脑和手机芯片供应将面临紧缩
item.description: 全球两大芯片制造商周四警告称，随着制造商优先满足构建人工智能基础设施所需的高利润芯片需求，计算机和智能手机公司将首当其冲承受其产品所用DRAM芯片日益短缺的冲击。【原文：Two of the world's top chipmakers warned on Thursday that computer and smartphone companies were set to bear the brunt of a worsening shortage of DRAM chips used in their products, as the makers prioritise demand for more lucrative chips required to build AI infrastructure.】

item.title: PicPay首次公开募股打破巴西企业四年上市荒
item.description: 巴西数字银行PicPay周四在纳斯达克上市，此前该公司通过首次公开募股筹集了4.34亿美元。PicPay由亿万富翁巴蒂斯塔家族控股，这是巴西企业时隔四年多首次实现新股上市。【原文：Brazilian digital bank PicPay, controlled by the billionaire Batista family, debuts on Nasdaq on Thursday after raising $434 million in an initial public offering, the first new stock listing by a Brazilian company ​in more than four years.】

item.title: 印度庞大的互联网与社交媒体应用市场
item.description: 印度是社交媒体公司最重要的增长市场之一，这些公司如今正面临限制年轻人使用呼声，因人们担忧"数字成瘾"问题。【原文：India is one of the most critical growth markets for social media companies, which are now facing calls to limit access to young people, amid fears of "digital addiction".】

item.title: 解读：MSCI是什么？它对印尼股市产生了哪些影响？
item.description: MSCI是资产管理行业（规模达139万亿美元）中的巨头，其决策对全球各国影响深远——印尼投资者本周便为此付出了代价。【原文：MSCI is a powerhouse within the $139 trillion asset management industry and its decisions are hugely consequential for countries around the world - as Indonesian investors learned this week to their cost.】

item.title: 美国启动调查：Waymo自动驾驶汽车在校区附近撞伤儿童，造成轻伤
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周四表示，已就上周发生在加州圣莫尼卡市一所小学附近的事故展开调查。当时Waymo自动驾驶汽车撞上一名儿童，造成轻伤。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said Thursday it is opening an investigation after a Waymo self-driving vehicle struck a child near an elementary school in Santa Monica, California last week, causing minor injuries.】

item.title: SAP股价或创2020年以来最大单日跌幅
item.description: 欧洲最大软件制造商SAP的股价周四创下2020年10月以来最大单日跌幅，下跌逾10%。该公司财报未能阻止股价下跌趋势，自2025年峰值以来，其市值已蒸发约1500亿美元。【原文：Shares in Europe's largest software maker SAP were set for their steepest daily fall since October 2020 on Thursday, down over 10% after results failed to stem a slide that has wiped around $150 billion off its market value from its 2025 peak.】

item.title: 诺基亚首席执行官称欧美科技公司相互依存
item.description: 诺基亚首席执行官贾斯汀·霍塔尔周四表示，欧美之间存在相互依赖关系，大型科技公司不能仅依赖单一大陆。此番言论发表之际，欧盟正考虑加强对本土产业的扶持力度。【原文：Europe and the United States are co-dependent and large technology companies cannot rely on a single continent, Nokia CEO Justin Hotard said on Thursday, as the European Union weighs stronger support for homegrown industry.】

item.title: 现代汽车因安全气囊故障将在美国召回约56.9万辆SUV
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周四表示，现代汽车因侧面帘式气囊存在部署不当问题，将在美国召回568,576辆帕里斯德运动型多功能车。【原文：Hyundai Motor is recalling 568,576 Palisade sports utility vehicles in the U.S. over improper deployment of side curtain airbags, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Thursday.】

item.title: 日本倚仗美国支持，在日元空头之战中采取战术性沉默
item.description: 日本央行高层正借助美国罕见的政策支持，在抗衡日元贬值的斗争中采取战术性沉默与精准沟通策略，在避免大规模干预的前提下推动日元汇率大幅攀升。【原文：Japan's top monetary officials are leveraging rare U.S. backing in their fight against the weak yen, using tactical silence and calibrated communication to drive the currency sharply higher without resorting to large-scale intervention.】

item.title: Deezer向法国版权机构Sacem授权人工智能检测工具，计划扩大推广范围
item.description: 音乐流媒体平台Deezer已将其人工智能检测技术授权给法国版权机构Sacem，达成一项打击音乐侵权的里程碑式商业协议。该公司正致力于推动该技术在行业内的广泛应用。【原文：Music streaming platform Deezer has licensed its artificial intelligence-detection technology to France's royalty agency Sacem in a landmark commercial deal to combat music fraud, as the company pursues wider industry adoption for the tool.】

item.title: 印度首席经济顾问称，印度应考虑对社交媒体实施年龄限制
item.description: 印度首席经济顾问呼吁政府对社交媒体应用设置年龄限制，以应对"数字成瘾"问题，并警告称在Meta和YouTube的最大用户市场中，儿童使用这些平台存在风险。【原文：India's chief economic adviser called on the government to set age-based limits on access to social media apps to counter "digital addiction", cautioning against use of platforms by children in the largest user market for Meta and YouTube.】

item.title: 嘉能可报告称2025年铜产量下降11%，力拓合作在即
item.description: 嘉能可周四表示，2025年其铜产量下降11%，不过由于多家矿山铜品位和回收率提高，下半年产量有所回升。【原文：Glencore's copper production declined by 11% in 2025, though higher copper grades and recoveries at several mines boosted output in the second half, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特斯拉股价在法兰克福上涨1.8%，财报公布次日
item.description: 特斯拉股价周四在法兰克福上涨1.8%，此前该公司宣布将向首席执行官埃隆·马斯克的人工智能公司xAI投资20亿美元，并表示其Cybercab无人驾驶出租车的生产计划正按计划推进，将于今年实现量产。【原文：Tesla shares rose 1.8% in Frankfurt on Thursday, a day after the company said it will invest $2 billion in CEO Elon Musk's artificial-intelligence company xAI and that production plans for its Cybercab robotaxi were on track for this year.】

item.title: 人头马君度集团销售额超预期，得益于美国市场回暖
item.description: 人头马君度集团第三季度销售额重回增长轨道，周四公布的业绩超出市场预期，主要得益于美国核心市场及主力产品干邑白兰酒销量的提升。【原文：Remy Cointreau's third quarter sales returned to growth and beat market forecasts on Thursday, driven by improving sales in the key U.S. market and of its main product, cognac.】

item.title: Meta股价在法兰克福上涨，因业绩与资本计划
item.description: 周四法兰克福早盘交易中，Meta股价上涨近7%，此前多家券商上调了目标股价。这家Instagram母公司公布的财报显示，其第一季度营收预期高于华尔街预期。【原文：Meta shares rose almost 7% in early Frankfurt trading on Thursday, after several brokers raised their target prices following results in which the Instagram owner forecast first-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations.】

item.title: 微软股价在法兰克福下跌6%，此前公布财报
item.description: 微软股价周四在法兰克福下跌6.2%，此前该公司表示上季度在人工智能领域的支出创下历史新高，且云计算业务增长放缓，令投资者感到担忧。【原文：Microsoft shares dropped 6.2% in Frankfurt on Thursday a day after the company said it had spent a record amount on artificial intelligence in the last quarter and posted slower cloud-computing growth, worrying investors.】

item.title: 贝恩公司称中国奢侈品市场预计2026年将反弹
item.description: 咨询公司贝恩公司周四表示，中国个人奢侈品市场预计将在2026年恢复温和增长，但警告称复苏将较为脆弱，且不同品牌和品类间的复苏态势将参差不齐。【原文：China's personal luxury goods market is expected to return to modest growth in 2026, consultancy Bain & Company said on Thursday, but warned the recovery would be fragile and uneven across brands and categories.】

item.title: H&M第四季度利润超预期增长，但冬季销售疲软
item.description: 瑞典时尚零售商H&M周四公布，得益于成本降低，其9月至11月利润实现超预期增长，但同时指出12月至1月以当地货币计价的销售额出现下滑。【原文：Swedish fashion retailer H&M reported on Thursday a forecast-beating jump in September-November profit helped by lower costs, but flagged a drop in December-January local-currency sales.】

item.title: 俄罗斯卢克石油公司将向美国凯雷集团出售国际资产
item.description: 俄罗斯第二大石油生产商卢克石油公司周四表示，已同意将其大部分海外资产出售给美国私募股权公司凯雷集团，交易总额约220亿美元，目前正等待美国政府批准。【原文：Russia's No. 2 oil producer Lukoil said on Thursday it had agreed to sell most of its foreign assets worth a total of around $22 billion to U.S. private equity firm Carlyle Group pending approval from the U.S. government.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，阿里巴巴将与中国的泽洛斯合并，共同打造价值20亿美元的无人驾驶汽车业务。
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士报道，阿里巴巴旗下物流部门计划将其自动驾驶业务菜鸟与中国的泽洛斯科技合并，组建估值约20亿美元的新实体。【原文：Alibaba's logistics arm plans to merge its autonomous-driving unit Cainiao with China's Zelos Technology, forming a new entity valued at approximately $2 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 赛诺菲2026年销售额目标定为高个位数增长，并计划实施股票回购
item.description: 法国制药商赛诺菲周四表示，预计2026年销售额将实现高个位数百分比增长，这主要得益于其重磅哮喘药物Dupixent以及部分新药的强劲需求。【原文：French drugmaker Sanofi said on Thursday it expects sales to grow by a high-single-digit percentage in 2026, banking on strong demand for its blockbuster asthma drug Dupixent and some newer medicines.】

item.title: 印度纺织品出口商在遭受美国关税打击后，将希望寄托于欧盟协议
item.description: 印度纺织品和服装出口商因8月下旬美国加征50%关税而遭受重创，正寄望于本周与欧盟达成的贸易协议来抵消部分损失，同时敦促新德里尽快与华盛顿达成协议。【原文：India’s textile and apparel exporters, hit by 50% U.S. tariffs imposed late in August, are banking on this week's trade agreement with the European Union to offset part of the damage, while urging New Delhi to secure a quick deal with Washington.】

item.title: ABB对2026年前景充满信心，启动20亿美元股票回购计划
item.description: ABB周四表示，对2026年充满信心。该公司公布的第四季度业绩略高于预期，并启动了20亿美元的新股回购计划。【原文：ABB on Thursday said it was feeling confident about 2026 as it reported fourth quarter earnings slightly ahead of forecasts and launched a new $2 billion share buyback.】

item.title: 德意志银行面临警方调查，却创下近二十年来最大年度利润
item.description: 德意志银行周四公布了自2007年以来最高的年度利润，此前该行第四季度业绩超出预期。就在一天前，德国联邦警察因涉嫌洗钱调查搜查了该银行。【原文：Deutsche Bank on Thursday reported its largest annual profit since 2007 after a stronger-than-expected fourth quarter, a day after German federal police searched the bank in connection with an investigation into alleged money-laundering.】
